Title: Microgrid Digital Twin Application for Future Virtual Power Plants
Authors: I. Idrisov, I. Veretennikov, Stepan P. Vasilev, Sebastian Gutierrez, F. M. Ibanez
Venue: Annual Conference of the IEEE Industrial Electronics Society
Abstract summary: The paper proposes using digital twins to address limitations of conventional virtual power plants for integrating distributed energy resources.

Title: Digital Twin models in industrial operations: State‐of‐the‐art and future research directions
Authors: Tsega Y. Melesse, V. Pasquale, S. Riemma
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the state-of-the-art and future research directions for digital twin models in industrial operations, but does not specifically address limitations for predictive maintenance and operational support in distributed energy resources.

Title: State-of-the-Art Review: The Use of Digital Twins to Support Artificial Intelligence-Guided Predictive Maintenance
Authors: Sizhe Ma, Katherine A. Flanigan, Mario Berg'es
Abstract summary: Current digital twin technologies have limitations in supporting fully automated predictive maintenance and operational support for distributed energy resources.

Title: Cognitive digital twin: An approach to improve the maintenance management
Authors: R. D. D'Amico, J. Erkoyuncu, S. Addepalli, Steven Penver
Venue: CIRP - Journal of Manufacturing Science and Technology
Abstract summary: This paper discusses the use of digital twins for maintenance management, including limitations and an ontological approach to develop a "Cognitive Twin" to improve integration.

Title: Predictive digital twin for wind energy systems: a literature review
Authors: Ege Kandemir, Agus Hasan, Trond Kvamsdal, Saleh Abdel-Afou Alaliyat
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the current state of predictive digital twin platforms for wind energy systems, identifying challenges and limitations.

Title: Towards a Distributed Digital Twin Framework for Predictive Maintenance in Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT)
Authors: Ibrahim Abdullahi, Stefano Longo, Mohammad Samie
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a distributed digital twin framework to improve predictive maintenance solutions in Industrial IoT, addressing limitations of current digital twin technologies.

Title: State-of-the-Art Review and Synthesis: A Requirement-based Roadmap for Standardized Predictive Maintenance Automation Using Digital Twin Technologies
Authors: Sizhe Ma, Katherine A. Flanigan, Mario Berg'es
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a requirement-based roadmap to address limitations of current digital twin technologies for standardized predictive maintenance automation.

Title: Digital Twin Models in Industrial Operations: A Systematic Literature Review
Authors: Tsega Y. Melesse, V. Pasquale, S. Riemma
Abstract summary: This paper does not discuss limitations of current digital twin technologies for predictive maintenance and operational support in DERs.
